description: Learned borrowing from Sanskrit ओम् (om) (symbol ॐ (oṃ)). The former (om) is used in both Buddhist and Hindu settings, while the latter (aum) is usually used only in Jain and Hindu settings.

entries.meaning: (Hinduism, Buddhism) A sacred, mystical syllable used in prayer and meditation.
examples: In fact it sounded exactly like the voice of Livia, her vanished sister, and, like her, it was intoning the Aum just as she used once to do at the beginning of her yoga sessions.

verbs.description: om (third-person singular simple present oms, present participle omming, simple past and past participle ommed)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To chant the sacred syllable om.
examples: Allen Ginsberg omming like a death rattle, his voice ravaged by the days of Hindu chants and gas.
